sage.camera.controllers

Class AbstractCameraController

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.camera.controllers.AbstractCameraController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICameraController
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FPCameraController, ThirdPersonChaseCameraController, ThirdPersonOrbitCameraController

    public abstract class AbstractCameraController
extends java.lang.Object
implements ICameraController
    This class acts as the abstract base class from which all concrete Camera Controllers are derived. It provides functions common to all camera controllers, deferring the implementation of most ICameraController methods to concrete subclasses.
    Author:
    Kenneth Barnett

      • AbstractCameraController

        public AbstractCameraController(ICamera camera,
                                SceneNode target,
                                IInputManager inputMgr,
                                java.lang.String inputControllerName)
        Constructs an AbstractCameraController which controls the specified ICamera.
        Parameters:
        camera - - The camera to control
        target - - The target the controller is attached to
        inputMgr - - The IInputManager which provides access to controllers
        inputControllerName - - the name of the controller containing the components which manipulate the third-person orbit camera

    • Method Detail

      • getIsEnabled

        public boolean getIsEnabled()
        Returns true if the camera controller is enabled; false if it is disabled.

        Enabled means that the camera controller controls the positioning and orientation (via user input) of the camera.

        Disabled means that the camera controller no longer controls the positioning and orientation (via user input) of the camera.

        Specified by:
        getIsEnabled in interface ICameraController

      • enable

        public void enable()
        Enables the camera controller. This means that the controller now affects the positioning of the camera and input affects the orientation of the camera.
        Specified by:
        enable in interface ICameraController

      • disable

        public void disable()
        Disables the camera controller. This means that the controller no longer affects the positioning of the camera and input no longer affects the orientation of the camera.
        Specified by:
        disable in interface ICameraController

      • getTarget

        public SceneNode getTarget()
        Returns the camera controller's target.
        Specified by:
        getTarget in interface ICameraController

      • getWorldUpVector

        public graphicslib3D.Vector3D getWorldUpVector()
        Returns a clone of the camera controller's Vector3D world "up" vector.
        Specified by:
        getWorldUpVector in interface ICameraController

      • setWorldUpVector

        public void setWorldUpVector(graphicslib3D.Vector3D worldUp)
        Sets the vector that the camera controller will use as the world "up" vector. The camera controller's default world up vector is (0, 1, 0).
        Specified by:
        setWorldUpVector in interface ICameraController

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the camera controller.
        Specified by:

      • setCursorImage

        public void setCursorImage(int type)
        Sets the camera controllers mouse cursor to a pre-defined cursor type.
        Specified by:
        setCursorImage in interface ICameraController
        Parameters:
        type - - The java pre-defined cursor value. Use Cursor static values to choose a type. e.g. Cursor.DEFAULT_CURSOR

      • setCursorImage

        public void setCursorImage(java.lang.String imageName,
                           java.lang.String cursorName,
                           java.awt.Point hotspot)
        Sets the camera controllers mouse cursor to a user defined cursor.
        Specified by:
        setCursorImage in interface ICameraController
        Parameters:
        imageName - - The file name (full path & file extension) of the cursor image.
        cursorName - - The name of the cursor.
        hotspot - - The cursor "hotspot". It is where the O.S. detects the "mouse click".

      • toggleMouseCursorVisibility

        public void toggleMouseCursorVisibility()
        Toggles the mouse cursor ON/OFF. This is NOT the crosshair of the camera controller.
        Specified by:
        toggleMouseCursorVisibility in interface ICameraController
